description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cjf6t","text":"Modified protocol for extracting RNA from the haptophyte Prymnesium parvum using Ambion Tri Reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":81,"length":18}],"data":{}},{"key":"2a7gr","text":"Original protocol with toubleshooting  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aukgh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8r0vc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C007EF50E17911EB8FB1D3749A73C134","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/AM9738#/AM9738"}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"DB60F8F0E17911EB8FB1D3749A73C134","id":121356,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Tri_reagent.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dysndq96.pdf"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.section: Homogenization and RNA extraction (ALL WORK DONE IN THE CHEMICAL FUME HOOD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eico0","text":"Warm the frozen centrifuge tube by cupping the area around the pellet in the palm of your hand. As soon as you see the edges of the pellet beginning to melt, add    TRI Reagent. Pipet up and down to dislodge pellet, and transfer to a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":162,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8o8gb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"167lg","text":"All liquid TRI Reagent and chloroform liquid waste should be ejected or decanted into the amber bottle labeled 'Phenol:Chloroform Waste' inside the fume hood. Any plasticware that comes into contact with either of these chemicals needs to be properly disposed of in the sharps bin inside the fume hood labeled 'Mutagen/Carcinogen Sharps Do Not Autoclave'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":354}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"CCFD3A10D4EC11EB8E5EA165A1FB3A6E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

Pipet slowly from the top, being careful not to disrupt the interphase. steps.section: Pellet Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4btk8","text":"Pour off the supernatant into a P. pavum waste container, and flash freeze the cell pellet in liquid nitrogen. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":32,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pellet Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vbg8","text":"Immediately add the TRI Reagent (below) or store in   freezer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9r2tq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euf7n","text":"This optional centrifugation is only rarely required to remove insoluble material from homogenates that contain high amounts of protein, polysaccharide, or extracellular material. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ts40","text":"Centrifuge at  . Orient the centrifuge tube so that cap hinge is on the outer edge of the rotor. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8m61g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47scp","text":"Proper orientation of the tube helps to avoid the pelleted RNA when removing the supernatant in subsequent steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e427v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88u2c","text":"You may not see a pellet at this stage, but that is okay. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2hhti","text":"Add  of 75% ethanol to wash the pellet. steps.section: RNA Precipitation (ALL WORK DONE AT THE RNA CLEAN WORK STATION)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gu49","text":"Discard the supernatant by taking off the initial volume with a 1 mL pipette tip. Briefly spin down the tube using the little bench top spinner, and then use a 200 mL pipet tip to get the last bit of liquid. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1amaf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tslh","text":"Again, even if you can't see the pellet, you will know that it is located on the on the bottom corner under the hinge. So be careful to avoid that side of the tube. Pipette away the supernatant by tipping the tube slightly towards you and pipetting the liquid from the bottom corner opposite the hinge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":303}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: RNA Precipitation (ALL WORK DONE AT THE RNA CLEAN WORK STATION)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"djbu4","text":"Air dry the RNA pellet for   by placing the tube on its side inside a folded kim wipe. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cm7e8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqg94","text":"Do not overdry the RNA pellet as this will greatly decrease its solubility. steps.section: Prepare Station and Materials
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7lg8a","text":"Using gloved hands freshly sprayed with RNAse away, get three 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes per sample from the bag in the RNA clean drawer. Cap each tube tightly and place the sealed bag back in the clean drawer. Label each tube vertically on the side with the sample's unique identifier. Write down the sample ID and description in your lab notebook. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8unh7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3stk5","text":"The identifier should start with a letter and be no more than 12 characters long. Write it carefully using a fine tip permanent marker as one of these tubes will contain your final sample that will be shipped off for RNA sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":233}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Station and Materials

steps.section: Prepare Station and Materials
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3o7qm","text":"Get RNA clean tips out from the clean drawer. Place one set of 1 mL pipettes and tips inside the chemical fume hood. Place one set of 50 mL and 1.5 mL tube racks in the chemical fume hood. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Station and Materials
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7r4d8","text":"Place two labeled 1.5 mL tubes per sample inside the chemical fume hood. Leave the third tube at the RNA clean workstation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
